word: God said to Cain, "If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door."  Reflections are not to be cast upon God's holy law, intimating that it is defective and needs improvement, as Satan had declared. God had made every provision that sinful man might overcome through faith in the promised Saviour. The law of God was just what God saw was for the good of the universe, and for the good of mankind.--Ms 43, 1900, pp. 1-3. ("The Prophet Enoch," typed August 2, 1900.)
